data.text:
Author: DENISAURUS News

All the latest news, law, current affairs, sport and entertainment stories from DENISAURUS News SERVICE. Email: denisaurusnews@outlook.com. Please read our terms & conditions.

PMB Says It Is Dishonest To Think He’s Not Offered Any Solution To Herdsmen Crisis

By Adenike Lucas President Muhammadu Buhari has insisted that he is working to end the herdsmen crisis. Nigeria’s number one citizen, met with the Catholic Bishops Conference of Nigeria (CBCN) led by Archbishop Ignatius Kaigama today. The bishops who made … Continue reading PMB Says It Is Dishonest To Think He’s Not Offered Any Solution To Herdsmen Crisis

Missing Iconic Nigerian “Princess Tutu” Painting Found In London

By Christian Smith An iconic Nigerian painting that has been missing for the more than four decades has been found in a “modest north London flat.” Ben Enwonwu’s 1974 masterpiece of the Ife princess Adetutu Ademiluyi, known as Tutu, appeared … Continue reading Missing Iconic Nigerian “Princess Tutu” Painting Found In London

Former Manchester United Defender Patrice Evra Joins West Ham For Free

By Christian Smith Patrice Evra, a former Manchester United Player has joined West Ham for free on a contract that ends in June 2018. The 36-year-old defender, who will wear the No27 shirt at the London Stadium, said: “I’m really … Continue reading Former Manchester United Defender Patrice Evra Joins West Ham For Free

EXCL: UK Journalist Arrested By Nigerian SARS Speaks Out About Impact Incident Is Having On Family

By Adenike Lucas A UK based journalist picked up by Nigeria’s Special Anti-Robbery Squad, SARS in the early morning of New Year’s day, has spoken about the impact the arrest has had on his family. Daniel Elombah’s and six members … Continue reading EXCL: UK Journalist Arrested By Nigerian SARS Speaks Out About Impact Incident Is Having On Family

In Remembrance Of Dr. Adegbite And Justice Orire

By Muhammad Ajah On Friday, July 21 2006 at the Prince Palace Hotel, Nkpokiti axis of the Presidential Avenue, Enugu, an event took place that keeps in memory the former and pioneer Secretary-General of the Nigerian Supreme Council for Islamic … Continue reading In Remembrance Of Dr. Adegbite And Justice Orire

Police Force Urged To Take Punitive Action Against Jimoh Moshood

By Adenike Lucas Lawmakers today urged the Inspector General of Police to relieve the Force’s Public Relations Officer, Jimoh Moshood of his job, following a derogatory statement made on TV against the Governor of Benue. The Chief Superintendent of Police, who … Continue reading Police Force Urged To Take Punitive Action Against Jimoh Moshood

Joshua Stimpson Found Guilty Of Murdering Ex-girlfriend

By Christian Smith A man who stabbed his ex-girlfriend to death in a shopping centre car park in Chatham, Kent has been found guilty of murder. Joshua Stimpson from Rochester, is said to have stabbed 23-year-old University of Kent student Molly … Continue reading Joshua Stimpson Found Guilty Of Murdering Ex-girlfriend

OPAN Holds Media Conference In Lagos To Tackle Scourge of Fake Online News

By Adenike Lucas The Online Publishers Association of Nigeria (OPAN), Nigeria’s premier association of digital/new media publishers and entrepreneurs is holding its first media conference. The conference, taking place at The Wheatbaker hotel in Ikoyi-Lagos has guest including, John Momoh … Continue reading OPAN Holds Media Conference In Lagos To Tackle Scourge of Fake Online News

Chelsea Vs Watford – LIVE BLOG

By Christian Smith After last week’s 3 – 0 defeat at Bournemouth, Chelsea are hoping to bag a win at Watford today. Kick off is at 8pm GMT. Blue boss, Antonio Conte could lose his job if his men fail … Continue reading Chelsea Vs Watford – LIVE BLOG
